Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.containers.arraylisthuge

Class ArrayListHugeLong

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.containers.arraylisthuge.ArrayListHugeAbstract
gov.sandia.gmp.util.containers.arraylisthuge.ArrayListHugeLong
public class ArrayListHugeLong extends ArrayListHugeAbstract
Container to hold intrinsic "long" types where the number of entries may exceed the Integer.MAX_VALUE limitation of Java arrays. One should not use this object to store small number of entries as the efficiency is not quite as good as standard array lists. Unlike standard array lists no facility is provided to remove entries (other than the last entry) as this can be very inefficient. Primary operational functions supported include: void add(long val); long get(long i); long getLast(); long removeLast(); Object clone(); long set(long i, long val); void setVector(long i, long val, int n); long increment(long i, long inc); void incrementVector(long i, long inc, int n); long scale(long i, long scl); void scaleVector(long i, long scl, int n); void swap(long i1, long i2); void swapVector(long i1, long i2, int n); void clear(); void resetSize(); void ensureCapacity(long capacity); void trimToSegmentSize();
Author:
jrhipp

    • clone

      Returns:
      a clone of this ArrayListHuge instance

    • ensureCapacity

      public void ensureCapacity(long capacity)
      Ensures that the capacity of this list is as least as big as the input capacity. The list capacity will be set to the nearest increment of the segment array element size (segArraySize) that is big enough to hold the input capacity.
      Parameters:
      capacity - The new capacity of this list which will be at least as big as the input capacity.

    • trimToSegmentSize

      public void trimToSegmentSize()
      Trims the excess capacity to the nearest segment allocation that can safely contain the current size.

    • getArraySegment

      public long[] getArraySegment(int seg)
      Returns an array containing all of the elements in this list in proper sequence (from first to last element).

      The returned array is not safe in the sense that it is the true array container of this list and should only be used but not modified.

      This method acts as bridge between array-based and collection-based APIs.

      Returns:
      The backing array of single segment of this list.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the list and removes all segment allocations.
